alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Richland (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 27 at 2:48AM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following counties, Dawson and Richland. * WHEN...Until 600 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 237 AM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sidney, Fairview, Richey, Lambert, Bloomfield, Enid, Midway, Crane and Wooley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
